p: Across the 274 national parks, 513 species (360 species in summer and 396 in winter) were included in this analysis (see S2 Table for projected trends of all species in all parks). The mean number of species included per park and emissions pathway in summer was 102.9 (range 66–153) and in winter was 142.9 (range 29–268). Results for potential colonizations and extirpations are presented in the main text, whereas improving, stable, and worsening trends are summarized in S1 Appendix.
